str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Third person singular active present of deo; also deon deh-on'; neuter active participle of the same; both used impersonally; it is Necessary.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
To make clear (visible, manifest), make known. From phaneros; to render apparent.
From en and pros; in front of (literally or figuratively) or time).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the base of basis; a step, i.e. Foot-breath; by implication, a rostrum, i.e. A tribunal.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
Each (of more than two), every one. As if a superlative of hekas; each or every.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From a primary komeo; properly, to provide for, i.e. to carry off.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To do, perform, accomplish; be in any condition, i.e. I fare; I exact, require.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.
And if, whether. From ei and te; if too.
A primary word; 'good'.
And if, whether. From ei and te; if too.
Worthless, wicked, base. Apparently a primary word; 'foul' or 'flawy', i.e. wicked.
